concise_definition: n. 泡沫, 泡沫状物; v. 起泡沫, 泡沫般地涌出

definitions.explanation_en: A mass of small bubbles formed on the surface of a liquid, typically by agitation or chemical reaction, often seen in beer, soap, or ocean waves.
definitions.explanation_cn: 液体表面因搅动或化学反应形成的大量小气泡集合体，常见于啤酒、肥皂水或海浪中。
definitions.example_en: The latte had a thick, creamy foam on top.
definitions.example_cn: 这杯拿铁顶部有一层浓稠的奶泡。

definitions.explanation_en: A lightweight, porous material made by trapping gas bubbles in a solid or liquid matrix, used for insulation, cushioning, or packaging.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种通过在固体或液体基质中包裹气泡制成的轻质多孔材料，常用于隔热、缓冲或包装。
definitions.example_en: The box was lined with polyurethane foam to protect the fragile items.
definitions.example_cn: 盒子内衬了聚氨酯泡沫，以保护易碎物品。

definitions.explanation_en: To form or produce bubbles on the surface, especially when a liquid is agitated or heated.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指液体因搅动或加热而在表面形成气泡。
definitions.example_en: The detergent foamed vigorously when mixed with water.
definitions.example_cn: 洗涤剂与水混合后剧烈起泡。

definitions.explanation_en: To speak or behave in an excited, irrational, or uncontrollable manner, often due to anger or emotion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因愤怒或情绪激动而语无伦次、行为失控。
definitions.example_en: He was foaming at the mouth with rage after hearing the news.
definitions.example_cn: 听到这个消息后，他气得怒发冲冠，口吐白沫。

comparison.analysis: “Bubbles”（气泡）指单个或零散的气体空腔，通常强调个体形态，如水中的小气泡；而 “foam” 是大量气泡聚集形成的稳定结构，具有整体性和持续性，常用于描述宏观现象，如奶泡或浪花。
“Lather”（肥皂泡/泡沫）特指由肥皂或清洁剂与水混合后产生的泡沫，具有明确的化学来源和用途（如剃须）；而 “foam” 是更广泛的术语，可涵盖自然、工业或物理过程产生的所有泡沫类型，不限于清洁产品。
“Froth”（泡沫/浮沫）与 “foam” 非常接近，常可互换，但 “froth” 更常用于描述轻薄、不稳定、易消散的泡沫，如啤酒顶部的薄层或愤怒时口边的白沫，带有轻微贬义或文学色彩；而 “foam” 更中性，可指厚实、持久的泡沫结构。
